This method saves you in many cases from the need of updating your code with every new device.
Most uses for an enum like this are the following:
The name of the operating system running on the device represented by the receiver (e.g. ‚ÄúiOS‚Äù or ‚ÄútvOS‚Äù).
The volume‚Äôs available capacity in bytes for storing nonessential resources.
